title: A double-feature mitochondrial proteome exploration show
content: In flowering plants, RNA editing is crucial in post-transcriptional RNA maturation. RNA editing involves C-to-U deaminations, affecting about 500 editing sites in mitochondria and 40 editing sites in plastids (Takenaka et al. 2013). RNA editing is essential for restoring functional proteins and can potentially influence protein activity, localization, or proteinâ€“protein interaction (Small et al. 2023). Remarkably, the lack of detected proteins corresponding to non-edited or partially edited transcripts suggests that RNA editing acts primarily as a repair mechanism rather than providing a regulatory advantage in plants.
